str2: And, even, also, namely.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.
And, even, also, namely.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remind, admonish, be reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember, recall. From ana and mimnesko; to remind; to recollect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Formerly, before. Adverb from pro; prior, sooner.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.
From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
Twice, entirely, utterly. Adverb from duo; twice.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and arneomai; to deny utterly, i.e. Disown, abstain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
